        <div class="sm-12"><section class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-INFBNR-RW-DEV" id="content_intro_information_banner_1">
    
    <div class="A-PNLPEARL-RW-ALL">
        <span class="icon icon-circle-fill-information" aria-hidden="true"></span><span class="visuallyhidden"></span>
        <div class="text info-banner-text"><ul>
<li><strong>Important notes</strong></li>
<li> </li>
<li>- The HSBC Mandatory Provident Fund - SuperTrust Plus is a mandatory provident fund scheme.</li>
<li> </li>
<li>- You should consider your own risk tolerance level and financial circumstances before making any investment choices or investing in the MPF Default Investment Strategy (the DIS). You should note that the DIS Constituent Funds, namely, the Core Accumulation Fund and the Age 65 Plus Fund, the DIS or a certain Constituent Fund may not be suitable for you. There may be a risk mismatch between the DIS Constituent Funds or a certain Constituent Fund and your risk profile (the resulting portfolio risk may be greater than your risk preference). When you are in doubt as to whether the DIS or a certain Constituent Fund is suitable for you (including whether it is consistent with your investment objectives), you should seek financial and/or professional advice. You should make the investment decision most suitable for you taking into account your circumstances.</li>
<li> </li>
<li>- You should note that the implementation of the DIS may have an impact on your MPF investments and accrued benefits. We recommend that you consult with the Trustee if you have doubts on how you are being affected.</li>
<li> </li>
<li>- The Guaranteed Fund invests solely in an approved pooled investment fund ('APIF') in the form of an insurance policy provided by HSBC Life (International) Limited. The guarantee is also given by HSBC Life (International) Limited. Your investments in the Guaranteed Fund, if any, are therefore subject to the credit risks of HSBC Life (International) Limited. Please refer to section 4 Risks of the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/mpf_scheme_brochure.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">MPF Scheme Brochure</span><span class="visuallyhidden">MPF Scheme Brochure  This link will open in a new window</span></a> for details of the credit risk.</li>
<li> </li>
<li>- The guarantee in the Guaranteed Fund only applies under certain conditions. Please refer to subsection 3.4.3(f) Guarantee features of the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/mpf_scheme_brochure.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">MPF Scheme Brochure</span><span class="visuallyhidden">MPF Scheme Brochure  This link will open in a new window</span></a> for details of the guarantee features (including in the context of payment of accrued benefits in instalments) and the Guarantee Conditions.</li>
<li> </li>
<li>- MPF Benefits, AVC Benefits and TVC Benefits are payable on a Members 65th birthday or on early retirement on or after reaching age 60. The accrued benefits can be paid in one lump sum or in instalments, at the Members election.  The accrued benefits can be paid in such form and on such terms and conditions as the Trustee may, to the extent not prohibited by the MPF Ordinance or General Regulation, prescribe. Please refer to subsection 6.7(c) Payment of MPF Benefits, AVC Benefits and TVC Benefits of the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/mpf_scheme_brochure.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">MPF Scheme Brochure</span><span class="visuallyhidden">MPF Scheme Brochure  This link will open in a new window</span></a> for details.</li>
<li> </li>
<li>- You should not invest based on the information shown on this website alone and should read the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/mpf_scheme_brochure.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">MPF Scheme Brochure</span><span class="visuallyhidden">MPF Scheme Brochure  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.</li>
<li> </li>
<li>- Investment involves risks. Past performance is not indicative of future performance. The value of financial instruments, in particular stocks and shares, and any income from such financial instruments, may go down as well as up. For further details including the product features and risks involved, please refer to the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/mpf_scheme_brochure.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">MPF Scheme Brochure</span><span class="visuallyhidden">MPF Scheme Brochure  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.</li>
</ul>
<div> </div>
<div>- Important  if you are in doubt about the meaning or effect of the contents of the MPF Scheme Brochure, you should seek independent professional advice.<br>
</div>
</div>
    </div>
</section>
</div>

            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_2">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="Security"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Change Investment Plan
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_4" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is there a limit to the number of fund switches that can be carried out per year? Are there any handling charges?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_5" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There is no limit to the number of fund switches that can be carried out per year, and there are no handling charges. However, we would remind you that the objective of MPF is to save for retirement and so your investment objectives should be longer term, dependent upon your personal circumstances.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_6" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the processing arrangements for change investment instructions under severe weather conditions?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_7" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Severe weather conditions in Hong Kong do not affect the usual processing of change investment instructions. Severe weather refers to the scenario where a typhoon signal No. 8 or above or a black rainstorm warning is issued by the Hong Kong Observatory, or an extreme conditions announcement is made by the HKSAR Government.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The above arrangement is provided for reference only and may be subject to change from time to time without notice.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_8" class="remove-bottom-space A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I change the investment allocation of my MPF account? What methods do you have?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_9" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. There are four methods to change the investment allocation:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Portfolio rebalance</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To change the investment allocation of your existing investments and new contributions (including but not limited to accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme). Necessary units will be redeemed to rebalance the portfolio of your existing investments.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Asset switch</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To switch all or some of the units from one or more Constituent Fund(s) and then re-allocate the redeemed amounts to another Constituent Fund or across any of the Constituent Funds. The investment allocation of your new contributions (including but not limited to accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme) will remain unchanged.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Contribution redirection</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To change the investment allocation of your new contributions (including but not limited to accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme). The investment allocation of your existing investments will remain unchanged.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Exit the Default Investment Strategy ('DIS')</strong><br> All of your existing investments, future contributions and accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme will be invested as per the investment allocation immediately before your exit the DIS. For avoidance of doubt, in such case, no subsequent re-balancing or de-risking of the investment allocation will be performed with regard to existing investments, future contributions and accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme due to the DIS.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_10" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I change the investment allocation of my MPF account?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_11" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When will my change of investment instructions be processed?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_12" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Through HSBC Internet Banking, HSBC HK Mobile Banking app or interactive voice response system of the HSBC MPF Member Hotline:</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If we receive your instructions through the HSBC Internet Banking, HSBC HK Mobile Banking app or the interactive voice response system of the HSBC MPF Member Hotline at or before 4:00 pm (Hong Kong time) on any business day, your instructions will normally be processed on the same business day. If we receive your instructions after 4:00 pm (Hong Kong time) on any business day, or anytime on a Saturday, public holiday or other non-business days, they will normally be processed on the following business day.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">An acknowledgement page (if you make instructions via the HSBC Internet Banking or HSBC HK Mobile Banking app) or recorded voice (if you make instructions via the interactive voice response system of HSBC MPF Member Hotline) will confirm the receipt of your instructions. When your instructions have been successfully processed, we will send a confirmation notice to your internet banking email box and HSBC HK Mobile Banking app message (if the instruction is made via the HSBC Internet Banking or HSBC HK Mobile Banking app) or post a confirmation notice to you (if the instruction is made via the interactive voice response system of HSBC MPF Member Hotline).</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Through paper form:</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">After receiving your properly-completed Change of Investment Instruction Form (<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inbp.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INBP</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INBP  This link will open in a new window</span></a>), your instruction will normally be processed within five business days. You can submit the change investment form by mail or placing to <a href="/mpf/services/#drop-in-box" target="_self">'HSBC MPF Drop-In Box' at designated HSBC branches.</a> Please note that a confirmation notice will be sent to you after the instruction has been successfully processed.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="#cautions">CAUTIONS</a><br></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Note:</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the processing of your Portfolio Rebalance or Asset Switch instruction is scheduled on any day that (i) the transfer of benefits under Employee Choice Arrangement ('ECA Transfer') is to be processed, or (ii) the refund of long service payment/severance payment ('Refund of LSP/SP') is to be processed, or (iii) on any of the consecutive days that ECA Transfer and/or Refund of LSP/SP are to be processed, the processing of your Portfolio Rebalance or Asset Switch instruction will be postponed to the next business day after the day(s) that such ECA Transfer and/or Refund of LSP/SP is/are being processed.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">However, if transfer* or claim of accrued benefits of your MPF account is processed on the same day with your change of investment instruction, your change of investment instruction will not be processed if your MPF account will be terminated after processing your transfer or claim of accrued benefit.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">* Include the transfer of accrued benefit from your contribution to a personal account if we have not received your transfer/claim instruction within 3 months after we are notified by your employer about your cessation of employment.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In any of the above circumstances, the processing of any further Portfolio Rebalance or Asset Switch instruction made before the processing of any prior pending consecutive Portfolio Rebalance instruction(s), Asset Switch instruction(s), ECA Transfer and/or Refund of LSP/SP will be postponed to the next business day after the day(s) that such pending consecutive Portfolio Rebalance instruction(s), Asset Switch instruction(s), ECA Transfer and/or Refund of LSP/SP is/are being processed. </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The above processing time is for reference only. HSBC shall not be liable for any delay.<br></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_13" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>In case of having multiple change investment instructions being submitted for the same processing date for my MPF account, how will they be processed?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_14" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The following is the handling of having more than one same type or different type of investment instructions received from paper and/or e-submission (i.e. Personal Internet Banking and/or Interactive Voice Response System and/or HSBC HK Mobile Banking App) channels, where applicable, and to be processed on the same business day.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">a. In case of having more than one Asset Switch of Existing Balance instructions or Portfolio Rebalance instructions or Contribution Redirection instructions being received and to be processed on the same business day, if same type of instructions are each received by paper and e-submission channels, only the last instruction of Asset Switch of Existing Balance instruction or Portfolio Rebalance instruction or Contribution Redirection instruction received from paper channel will be effective in the account record. Please note that the Interactive Voice Response System does not support the Asset Switch of Existing Balance instruction.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">b. In case of having both Asset Switch of Existing Balance instruction and Portfolio Rebalance instruction being received from paper and to be processed on the same business day, only the Portfolio Rebalance instruction will be processed.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">c. In case of having both Asset Switch of Existing Balance instruction and Contribution Redirection instruction being received from paper and to be processed on the same business day, both of the instructions will also be processed.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">d. In case of having both Contribution Redirection instruction and Portfolio Rebalance instruction being received from paper and to be processed on the same business day, if Contribution Redirection instruction is the last processed instruction, your existing investments held in the account will be processed in accordance with the Portfolio Rebalance instruction and new contributions to be received will be invested according to the Contribution Redirection instruction. If Portfolio Rebalance instruction is the last processed instruction, both of your existing investments and new contributions to be received will be invested according to the Portfolio Rebalance instruction.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">e. If your Contribution Redirection instruction is received from paper channel while the Portfolio Rebalance or Asset Switch of Existing Balance instruction is received from e-submission channel and to be processed on the same business day, your new contributions to be received will be invested according to the Contribution Redirection instruction and your existing investments held in the account will be processed in accordance with the Portfolio Rebalance instruction or Asset Switch of Existing Balance instruction.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">f. If your Portfolio Rebalance instruction is received from paper channel and the Contribution Redirection instruction or Asset Switch of Existing Balance instruction is received from e-submission channel and to be processed on the same business day, only the Portfolio Rebalance instruction will be processed.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">g. If your Asset Switch of Existing Balance instruction is received from paper channel while the Contribution Redirection is received from e-submission channel and to be processed on the same business day, your existing investments held in the account will be processed in accordance with the Asset Switch of Existing Balance instruction, and new contributions to be received will be invested according to the "Contribution Redirection" instruction.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">h. If your Asset Switch of Existing Balance instruction is received from paper channel while the Portfolio Rebalance is received from e-submission channel and to be processed on the same business day, only the Portfolio Rebalance instruction will be processed.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">i. In case of having both Contribution Redirection instruction and Portfolio Rebalance instruction to invest in the Default Investment Strategy (DIS) being received from paper and to be processed on the same business day, only the Portfolio Rebalance instruction to invest in the DIS will be processed.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The information provided is for reference only, which may be subject to change without notice. No liability is accepted for any loss or damage arising from any reliance upon such information.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_15" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I change my investment allocation to Default Investment Strategy ('DIS')?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_16" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, DIS is one of the investment options for you if the features of DIS fit your own circumstances.</p>
</div></div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_4">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">

            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_3">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="Change-of-Member-Details"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Change of Member Details
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_18" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I move, what should I do?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_19" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You should inform us of your new address and any changes of contact number, etc. by completing a Personal Details Change Form. Download <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in91.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">IN91 form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">IN91 form  This link will open in a new window</span></a> .<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_20" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I want to update contact details of my MPF account, can I do the updating online?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_21" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are an HSBC MPF scheme member who also has a bank account with HSBC, you can update your MPF account information listed below by logging on:</p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>HSBC Online Banking with your physical security device / Mobile Security Key or</li> 
 <li>HSBC HK Mobile Banking app (HSBC HK App).</li> 
</ol>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM M-BSCTBL-RW-RBWM" role="region"><div data-accessibility-tick-icon-text="available" data-accessibility-cross-icon-text="not available" id="content_main_basicTable_3" class="table-wrapper
            ">

</div>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_22" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are an HSBC MPF scheme member without a bank account with HSBC, please complete and return the Personal Details Change Form (Download <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in91.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">IN91 form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">IN91 form  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) to our MPF Administration for any updates of your contact information.<br></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For details, you can contact our customer service hotline.<br></p>
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">* The Correspondence address of your MPF account will be updated by updating the new address and selecting to update the new address as your account(s) correspondence address and selecting to applying the changes to MPF account(s) at the relevant sections on HSBC HK App.<br></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_23" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I change my preferred language for my HSBC MPF account(s)?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_24" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can change your preferred language by completing a Personal Details Change Form (<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in91.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">IN91</span><span class="visuallyhidden">IN91  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) or making a verbal instruction via the HSBC MPF Member Hotline on +<a href="tel:+852-3128-0128" class="no-link" role="presentation">852 3128 0128</a>.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    <div class="anchor" id="changing-jobs"></div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_5">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_6" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_4">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="Changing-Jobs"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Changing Jobs
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_25" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When I change jobs, how can I handle my MPF accrued benefits?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_26" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can choose one of the options below. Your options include: </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Retaining your accrued benefits in a personal account in the existing HSBC MPF scheme </li> 
 <li>Transferring them to a personal account in any MPF scheme of your choice<br> </li> 
 <li>Transferring them to your new account under your new employer's MPF scheme<br> </li> 
 <li>Transferring them to your existing account in an Industry Scheme (if applicable)<br> </li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">As you are accumulating your funds for retirement purpose, it is important that you consider the long term financial strength and security of the MPF service providers when making your decision.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_27" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I check whether my employer has paid the last contribution for me?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_28" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can check the latest contribution record of your account through any of the following ways:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Logon to Internet Banking (Personal Customers)<br> </li> 
 <li>Call the HSBC MPF Member Hotline on <a href="tel:+85231280128" class="no-link" role="presentation">+852 3128 0128</a> (Please refer to the section 'HSBC MPF Member Hotline' in <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/member-service-guide.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Member Service Guide</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Member Service Guide  This link will open in a new window</span></a> for the user's guide)<br> </li> 
 <li>Check your account at HSBC or Hang Seng Bank's ATMs using your ATM card or credit card with HSBC<br> </li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_29" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What should I do if I leave my current employment and become a self-employed person?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_30" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You should decide how to treat your MPF benefits accrued in your current employment account (<a href="/mpf/products/employees/situation-changed/#Changing-Jobs" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">View Changing Jobs</span><span class="visuallyhidden">View Changing Jobs  This link will open in a new window</span></a>). You also need to enrol yourself into an MPF scheme as a <a href="/mpf/documents/self-employed/#self-employed-form" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">self-employed person</span><span class="visuallyhidden">self-employed person  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_5">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="flexi-contributions"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Flexi-Contributions
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_31" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I set up regular monthly Flexi-Contributions, can I make any additional lump sum contributions in the future?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_32" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you may use the Flexi-Contributions Application Form (<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inpc.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INPC</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INPC  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) to make ad hoc lump sum contributions after you have set up your regular Flexi-Contributions.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_33" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I set up a Direct Debit Authorization ("DDA") to make Flexi-Contributions? How long does it take for the DDA setup?<br>  </strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, if you choose Regular contributions, the contributions must be made by direct debit. If you choose a Lump sum contributions, you may make the contributions either by crossed cheque or via direct debit. To set up a direct debit, please complete Section G 'Direct Debit Authorization' ("DDA")  in the Flexi-Contributions Application Form (<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inpc.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INPC</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INPC  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) during the setup of your Flexi-Contributions.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In general, if you establish a DDA instruction via HSBC / Hang Seng Bank account, your DDA set up request will be processed within 4 working days upon receipt of your application. For the DDA instruction which established via other bank accounts, the relevant Bank takes around 20 working days to setup the DDA. A 'Confirmation of direct debit authorisation' will be sent to you upon completion of your application.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I change or cancel my Flexi-Contributions instructions, or change bank account for direct debit?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can simply complete a Change of Regular Flexi-Contributions Instruction Form (<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inpa.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INPA</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INPA  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) and send it to us. To avoid any failure of direct debit transactions when you change the bank account for direct debit, please do not cancel the direct debit instruction of your previous bank account until your new designated bank account has been debited for the first time.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_34" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are there any restrictions for withdrawing my Flexi-Contributions?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_35" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You may request to withdraw your Flexi-Contributions up to 12 times in a financial year (from 1 July to 30 June each year), subject to a minimum of HKD5,000 per withdrawal.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_36" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I withdraw my Flexi-Contributions? Are there any handling charges?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_37" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You need to complete a Flexi-Contributions Partial Withdrawal Request Form (<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inpd.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INPD</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INPD  This link will open in a new window</span></a>). There is no handling charge. Please follow the instructions and requirements stated on the form.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_38" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I make additional Voluntary Contributions through deductions from my salary?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_39" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. To make regular additional Voluntary Contributions through deductions from your salary, you should complete a Change of Additional Voluntary Contribution Arrangement Form (<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in55.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">IN55</span><span class="visuallyhidden">IN55  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) and ask your employer to make the arrangements for you.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_40" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the difference between making voluntary contributions through deductions from my salary and Flexi-Contributions by debiting from my bank account?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_41" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Both are voluntary contributions in addition to your mandatory contributions. The major differences are as follows:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>You can set up Flexi-Contributions directly with us without going through your employer. It is totally private and independent from your employer. You can also choose your preferred direct debit date. You do not need your employer's consent to withdraw additional contributions you have made by this method.</li> 
 <li>However, if you would like to make voluntary contributions through deductions from your salary, you must set up the arrangement via your employer. The contribution date will be the same as that of your mandatory contributions. If there is contractual arrangement of voluntary contributions in your scheme, these will require your employer's consent for withdrawal.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Learn more about <a href="/mpf/products/employees/managing/#flexi-contributions">Flexi-Contributions</a>.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_6">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_7" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_6">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="forms"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Forms
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_42" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If my HKID card only contains the year of my birth and I do not have any other document of identity to prove my exact date of birth, what day and month should I put on the application form?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_43" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You should put '31 December' as the day and month. Likewise, if your HKID card only contains the year and month but not the day, you should put the last day of the month.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_44" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is a certified true copy?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_45" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">A certified true copy is a duplicated copy which is certified by an authorised party that it has been photocopied from an original document. Customers can bring along a completed application form together with all original supporting documents to any of our <a href="/mpf/services/#branch">designated HSBC branches</a>. Our MPF Specialist will assist them to prepare certified true copies. Alternatively, the certified true copies can be signed by public accountant/lawyer/banker/notary public acceptable to entities of HSBC Group or a member of Hong Kong Institute of Chartered Secretaries (HKICS) to make such certification.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_7">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_8" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_7">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="fund-information"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Fund Information
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_46" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I check the unit prices of the MPF funds?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_47" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The Fund Information provides you with the <u><a target="_blank" href="/mpf/products/funds/prices-and-performance/#unit-prices" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">unit prices</span><span class="visuallyhidden">unit prices  This link will open in a new window</span></a></u>.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_48" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Other than the unit prices available on the HSBC MPF website, where can I check the unit prices?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_49" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Current unit prices are also available through these channels:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The section Explore all HSBC MPF constituent funds in HSBC HK Mobile Banking app (Tap Home on the bottom menu > select your HSBC MPF account >  Explore all HSBC MPF constituent funds)<br> </li> 
 <li>HSBC MPF Member Hotline on <a href="tel:+85231280128" class="no-link" role="presentation">+852 3128 0128</a> (Please refer to the section 'HSBC MPF Member Hotline' in <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/member-service-guide.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Member Service Guide</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Member Service Guide  This link will open in a new window</span></a> for the user's guide) <br> </li> 
 <li>Hong Kong Economic Times<br> </li> 
 <li>South China Morning Post<br> </li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_50" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I check the past performance of the MPF funds?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_51" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The <a href="/mpf/products/funds/prices-and-performance/#cumulative-performance" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">cumulative performance</span><span class="visuallyhidden">cumulative performance  This link will open in a new window</span></a> of the Fund Information provides you with the past performance histories of the funds.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_52" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How are the unit prices determined?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_53" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The unit prices are calculated based on the net asset value of each fund, ie the value of investments less fees and charges, divided by the number of units issued. (With the exception of the unit prices for MPF Conservative Fund on or before 30 June 2015, where fees and charges were deducted directly from a member's account by unit deduction.)</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_54" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the MPF Conservative Fund (CPF)?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_55" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The MPF legislation requires each MPF scheme to offer a CPF. Our CPF is a low risk fund, investing in high grade Hong Kong HKD- denominated monetary instruments such as treasury bills, bills of exchange, commercial paper, certificates of deposits or interbank deposits, and other ancillary investments allowed under the General Regulation. The investment objective is to achieve a rate of return higher than that available for savings deposits, however returns are not guaranteed.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_56" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the fees and charges deduction methods an MPF Conservative Fund (CPF) can adopt?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_57" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">An MPF Conservative Fund may use one of two methods for deduction of fees and charges, namely (i) 'Fund Level Deduction;, that is, deducting the fees and charges from the assets of the MPF Conservative Fund or (ii) 'Member Level Deduction', that is, directly deducting the fees and charges from member's account by way of unit deduction.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">From 1 December 2000 to 30 June 2015, the MPF Conservative Fund of HSBC Mandatory Provident Fund  SuperTrust Plus adopted method (ii), that is, deducting the fees and charges from member's account by way of unit deduction.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">From 1 July 2015 and onwards, the MPF Conservative Fund of HSBC Mandatory Provident Fund  SuperTrust Plus adopts method (i), that is, deducting the fees and charges from the assets of the fund.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_58" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why are fees and charges for the MPF Conservative Fund (CPF) being deducted from my account?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_59" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">According to the MPF legislation, fees and charges can be deducted from the CPF only when the investment return is higher than the prescribed savings rate which is regularly published by the MPFA.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">From 1 December 2000 to 30 June 2015, the CPF of HSBC MPF scheme adopted method (ii), that is, directly deducting the fees and charges from member's account by way of unit deduction. The unit prices of the CPF have, therefore, not taken into account the deduction of fees and charges. During that period, the fees and charges for CPF were deducted in the form of units from a member's account only after the investment return and prescribed savings rate for each month were ascertained.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_60" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When and how are the fees and charges of the CPF under the HSBC MPF scheme be deducted from July 2015 onwards?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_61" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">From 1 July 2015, fees and charges accrue on a daily basis, and are reflected daily in the fund's unit prices, net asset value and fund performance quoted.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_62" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the Guaranteed Fund?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_63" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Our Guaranteed Fund is a low risk fund providing you with a guaranteed interest rate, provided certain conditions are met. If any of the Guarantee Conditions are met on withdrawal or transfer of balance, members will be entitled to the Actual Balance or the Guaranteed Balance, whichever is greater.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_64" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the guarantee features and Guarantee Conditions?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_65" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The guarantee in the Guaranteed Fund under the HSBC Mandatory Provident Fund - SuperTrust Plus only applies under certain conditions. Please refer to the 'Guarantee feature' under 'Guaranteed Fund' in the MPF Scheme Brochure for details of the guarantee features (including in the context of payment of accrued benefits in instalments) and the Guarantee Conditions.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_66" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What do you mean by crystallisation for the investment in the Guaranteed Fund?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_67" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This is an action that will be performed by the administrator of the HSBC Mandatory Provident Fund - SuperTrust Plus ('Administrator') at the end of each year, starting in 2016. It is for members who have reached the age of 65 and still have investment in the Guaranteed Fund. The Administrator will calculate the Guarantee for these members, equivalent to the amount they would entitled if they had withdrawn their benefits from the Guaranteed Fund on 31 December in that year using grounds that meet the Guarantee Conditions. For details, please click <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/gtfcc_faq.pdf"><u>here</u></a> for the Guaranteed Fund Changes - Crystallisation's FAQs.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_68" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the guaranteed interest rate for the Guaranteed Fund?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_69" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The rate for the financial year from 1 July 2023 to 30 June 2024 is 0.15% per annum.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The rate for the financial year from 1 July 2024 to 30 June 2025 is 0.20% per annum.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_70" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How often will the guaranteed interest rate change?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_71" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The rate will be reviewed annually and determined at the beginning of each financial year, ie 1 July each year.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_72" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I invest my MPF monies in HSBC shares or unit trusts?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_73" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No. By law, you must invest your MPF monies in the funds offered by the MPF scheme you participate in.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_74" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the Default Investment Strategy (DIS)?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_75" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The DIS comprises of 2 Consistent Funds, namely the Age 65 Plus Fund (A65F) and the Core Accumulation Fund (CAF). DIS is a ready-made investment arrangement mainly designed for those members who are not interested or do not wish to make an investment choice, and is also available as an investment choice itself, for members who find it suitable for their own circumstances. Starting from 1 April 2017, for those members who do not make an investment choice when they set up a new MPF account, their new contributions and accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme will be invested in accordance with the DIS.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The DIS aims to balance the long term effects of risk and return through investing in two Constituent Funds, namely the A65F and the CAF, according to the pre-set allocation percentages at different ages. The DIS will manage investment risk exposure by automatically reducing the exposure to higher risk assets and correspondingly increasing the exposure to lower risk assets as the member gets older. Such de-risking is achieved by way of reducing the holding in the CAF and increasing the holding in the A65F over time. The asset allocation stays the same up until 50 years of age, then reduces steadily until age 64, after which it stays steady again. For further details of the DIS, please refer to the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/mpf_scheme_brochure.pdf">MPF Scheme Brochure</a>.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_76" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the funds included in the Default Investment Strategy (DIS)?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_77" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The DIS comprises of two Constituent Funds, namely the Core Accumulation Fund (CAF) and the Age 65 Plus Fund (A65F).<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_78" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are Core Accumulation Fund (CAF) and Age 65 Plus Fund (A65F)?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_79" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Core Accumulation Fund (CAF) and Age 65 Plus Fund (A65F) are the two Constituent Funds that form the Default Investment Strategy (DIS). The CAF provides capital growth for  members by investing in a globally diversified manner and will invest around 60% in higher risk assets (generally mean equities or similar investments) and 40% in lower risk assets (those assets not being higher risk assets, including without limitation global bonds and money market instruments) of its net asset value whereas the A65F provides stable growth for the retirement savings to members by investing in a globally diversified manner and will invest around 20% in higher risk assets and 80% in lower risk assets of its net asset value.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_80" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I invest my MPF monies in Core Accumulation Fund (CAF) and/or Age 65 Plus Fund (A65F)?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_81" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. The Core Accumulation Fund (CAF) and the Age 65 Plus Fund (A65F) can be standalone investments. Members should note that, if you choose the CAF and/or the A65F as standalone investments (rather than as part of the DIS), the de-risking to automatically reduce the risk exposure as the member approaches retirement age will not be applicable.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_82" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>For Constituent Funds that hold foreign investments, how will the performance of the foreign investments be referenced to calculate the fund price if it's a non-business day in the overseas market but it's a business day in Hong Kong?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_83" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The unit price of Constituent Funds will be determined at each valuation day  a business day or a day as determined by the trustee  in accordance with the Master Trust Deed. Generally, when a relevant overseas market is closed for a holiday but the Hong Kong market remains open, the value of the foreign assets will be calculated by referencing the latest available traded price on the trading market. This is usually the closing price at the close of business of the last session of that market prior to the relevant valuation day. </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    <div class="anchor" id="mobile-banking-app"></div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_8">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_9" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_8">
    
    

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            HSBC HK Mobile Banking app (MPF service)
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_84" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>What MPF mobile services are available on the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app?</strong></h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Via the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app, you can now:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>View your MPF account balances, account returns, asset distribution, contribution and transaction history in last 12 months<br> </li> 
 <li>Check HSBC MPF funds cumulative investment performance<br> </li> 
 <li>Manage your MPF portfolio, including rebalancing, asset switching, redirecting funds and invest in Default Investment Strategy<br> </li> 
 <li>Open an MPF personal account for account consolidation*</li> 
 <li>Consolidate Personal Account(s)</li> 
 <li>Make appointment with MPF specialist</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">* Applicable to existing HSBC customers without HSBC MPF personal account</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<h3><strong>Who can use HSBC MPF mobile journey in the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app?</strong></h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Customers with an HSBC MPF account and is a registered user of HSBC Personal Internet Banking can access this feature on the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you dont have an HSBC banking account and is only using HSBC MPF service , you will need to apply or use your existing HSBC Personal Internet Banking credentials (if any) to log on to the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<h3><strong>Is there a charge to view/manage my MPF accounts on the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app?</strong></h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you dont have to pay any fees to view or manage your MPF account(s) on HSBC HK Mobile Banking app.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<h3><strong>How do I access my MPF accounts on HSBC HK Mobile Banking app?</strong></h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can view your overall MPF account balance after logging on to HSBC HK Mobile Banking app. You can access MPF balances, account returns, fund performance, asset distribution and contribution and transaction history in last 12 months of all your HSBC MPF account(s) by clicking onto the HSBC MPF balance under the Home tab of the bottom menu.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<h3><strong>How long will it take to process changes of investment instructions in the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app?</strong></h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If we receive your instruction at or before 4:00pm (Hong Kong time) on business days, the instructions will normally be processed on the same business day. If we receive your instruction after 4:00pm (Hong Kong time) on business days or any time on a Saturday, public holiday or non-business day, it will normally be processed on the next business day.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<h3><strong>Will I be notified when an investment instruction for my MPF account is placed via HSBC HK Mobile Banking app? </strong></h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Youll get a confirmation once we receive your instructions via the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app. Well send confirmation notice through Personal Internet Banking and HSBC HK Mobile Banking app after processing your instruction.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<h3><strong>Can I manage HSBC MPF accounts by PC/desktop?</strong></h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can view and manage your HSBC MPF account(s) after logging on to HSBC Personal Internet Banking.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<h3><strong>What types of MPF accounts can I view on HSBC HK Mobile Banking app?</strong></h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can view employee accounts, self-employed accounts, personal accounts, tax deductible voluntary contributions accounts and flexi-contribution accounts.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<h3><strong>What information is available on the fund performance page?</strong></h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The fund performance page shows the cumulative performance of all HSBC MPF constituent funds over a 1-month, 3-month, 6-month, 1-year, 3-year or 5-year period, or since the funds launch. Details such as investment objectives, launch date, fund expense ratio, risk rating, portfolio allocation and top 10 portfolio holdings (%) are also available.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<h3><strong>What options are there for me to change my MPF investment instruction in HSBC HK Mobile Banking app?<br> </strong></h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Portfolio Rebalance</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Portfolio Rebalance will change the investment allocation for both existing investments and new contributions (including accrued benefits transferred from another registered scheme).<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Contribution Redirection</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Contribution Redirection will change the investment allocation for new contributions only but wont affect existing investments and balances.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Asset Switch</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Switch units and reallocate redeemed amounts. Investment allocation of new contributions will remain unchanged.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Default Investment Strategy (DIS)</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This instruction reallocate your existing investments and new contributions using the Default Investment Strategy (DIS).</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_9">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_10" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_9">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="long-service-payment"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Long Service Payment or Severance Payment
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_85" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why has an amount been deducted to offset Long Service Payment or Severance Payment from my account?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>
