            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_86" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">According to sections 31IA and 31YAA of the Employment Ordinance, section 12A of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance and the governing rules of the Scheme, your employer has the right to offset Long Service Payment or Severance Payment from accrued benefits derived from employer's contributions made to the Scheme.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_87" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>There are different types of contributions under member's MPF account, is there any offset sequence when HSBC handling the request for refund or claim of long service payment or severance payment?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_88" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. The member's vested accrued benefits derived from the employer's contributions will be used for the offsetting according to the following sequence:</p>
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL">
<li>Employer voluntary contributions (if applicable)</li>
<li>Employer's ORSO transfers (if applicable)</li>
<li>Employer special contributions (if applicable)</li>
<li>Employer mandatory contributions</li>
</ol>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_89" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How will the refund be paid to me?  How long does it take to process?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_90" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If employer has submitted the completed Payment Proof for Long Service Payment/Severance Payment (INLS) and signed by both the employer and employee to us, which the Long Service Payment/Severance Payment has not been paid by employer, we will refund to you by direct deposit into your bank account with sole account holder or send you a crossed cheque in accordance to the Employees receipt arrangement which you selected in Section D of the Payment Proof for Long Service Payment/Severance Payment (INLS).<br> <br> Please note that if you choose to have the benefits to be paid to you by direct deposit into a bank account with sole account holder, for verification purpose, please provide supporting document which shows bank account number and name of account holder, such as copy of bank statement, copy of bank ATM card or copy of bank reference letter etc. If the relevant supporting document is not provided, we are unable to proceed with direct deposit to your bank account and the method of payment will be changed to be by cheque without prior notice.<br> <br> Upon receipt of all contributions and required documents from the employer, it generally takes us 18 working days to process.  Once the fund units have been redeemed, we will remit the refund to you within 5 working days*.<br> <br> *From the day following the day on which the trustee has redeemed the fund units in the member's account to the working day on which the trustee has paid the refund to the employee (exclusive of the day of redemption of fund units by the trustee).</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_10">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="password-pin"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Password / PIN
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_91" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Where can I apply for an MPF phone PIN?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_92" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You do not need to apply for an MPF phone PIN. It is issued to you automatically after your enrolment. If you previously have an MPF account with HSBC MPF and the PIN has been issued to you, the same PIN will apply to all of your subsequent new MPF accounts even they are in different MPF membership number. No new PIN will be reissued automatically under normal circumstances. If necessary, you may request for a new one by calling the HSBC MPF Member Hotline on +852 3128 0128, select preferred language and then press #. HSBC MPF customer service representatives will be happy to arrange a new PIN and post it to you.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_93" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I have forgotten my MPF phone PIN. How do I get a replacement?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_94" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please call the HSBC MPF Member Hotline on <a href="tel:+85231280128" class="no-link" role="presentation">+852 3128 0128</a>, select preferred language and then press #. HSBC MPF customer service representatives will be happy to arrange a new PIN and post it to you.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_10">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_11" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_11">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="Tax"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Tax
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_95" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are employee's mandatory contributions, voluntary contributions and Flexi-Contributions deductible expenses under salaries tax?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_96" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Mandatory contributions made by employees and voluntary contributions paid into tax deductible voluntary contributions accounts are tax deductible, but voluntary contributions did not contribute into tax deductible voluntary contributions accounts and Flexi-Contributions are not tax deductible. For the details of tax issues, please refer to the latest announcements by the Inland Revenue Department of the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_12">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="transfer-in-out"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Transfer-in/out and withdrawal summary and details of transactions - General
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_97" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I want to obtain detailed information of transfer-in/out, withdrawal and transaction(s) processed in my MPF account, what should I do? Information of which period(s) will be provided? Is there any handling charge for this service? What is the maximum number of requests I can make each year?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_98" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can obtain the information by submitting a signed written request to the following address:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Pensions Administration<br> The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited<br> PO Box 73770<br> Kowloon Central Post Office</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note that you should state your full name, relevant employer ID, membership number(s) or HKID/passport number in your signed written request. If you wish to obtain the information of transfer-in/out, withdrawal and details of transactions for more than one MPF account, please provide the employer ID and membership number of those accounts. Please be reminded that your signature must be the same as your last submitted specimen.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Upon receipt of complete information as stated above, we will provide a transfer-in/out and withdrawal summary and details of transactions of the six most recent quarters which ends on the last calendar day of March, June, September or December.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There is no handling charge and limitation on the number of request you can make.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_99" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What kind of information does the 'Transfer-in/out and withdrawal summary' provide?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_100" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This section summarises all transfer-in, transfer-out and withdrawal transactions successfully processed in your MPF account within the six most recent quarters.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_101" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What kind of information does the 'Details of Transactions' provide?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_102" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">All transaction(s) processed successfully within the six most recent quarters will be recorded in the 'Details of Transactions'. It is presented in ascending order of the fund name in English and in chronological order of the transaction date.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_103" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the opening balance and closing balance shown in the 'Details of Transactions'?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_104" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Opening balance is the number of units of the fund held in your MPF account as at the start date of the six quarters period as stated in the statement. Closing balance is the number of units of the fund held in your MPF account as at the end date of the six quarters period as stated in the statement.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><em>Example:</em><br>
If the period stated in the statement is from 1 January 2012 to 30 June 2013, then the opening balance is the number of units held as at 1 January 2012 and the closing balance is the number of units held as at 30 June 2013.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_105" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why is the closing balance of a fund zero?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_106" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The closing balance may become zero when you have transferred or withdrawn all units from a fund, or terminated your account on or before the end date of the six quarters period.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_107" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why could I not find the 'investment returns' in the 'Details of Transactions'?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_108" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Only transaction(s) processed successfully would be shown in the 'Details of Transactions' section but 'investment returns' is not a transaction. However, you may refer to the 'investment returns' stated in your 'MPF Member Benefit Statement' of the corresponding financial year.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_109" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I cancel my application of transfer/withdrawal of accrued benefits just submitted?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_110" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your application has been submitted but not yet been completed, you may cancel your transfer/ withdrawal application by submitting a written instruction or making a verbal instruction* via the HSBC MPF Member Hotline on +<a href="tel:+852-3128-0128" class="no-link" role="presentation">852 3128 0128</a>. If the fund units have been redeemed, a written instruction must be given to bear the potential losses.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">* The verbal instruction is only applicable for:</p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li><span class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">Transfer of MPF accrued benefits from employer/employees portion of contributions</span></li> 
 <li><span class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">Employees withdrawal of the mandatory contributions or voluntary contributions</span></li> 
</ol>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_111" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I request to reissue another cheque for an expired/a lost cheque issued by HSBC MPF?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_112" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your cheque issued by HSBC MPF has been expired or lost, you can apply to reissue another cheque by submitting a written instruction or making a verbal instruction via the HSBC MPF Member Hotline on +<a href="tel:+852-3128-0128" class="no-link" role="presentation">852 3128 0128</a>.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_113" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I change the payment method of my claim/withdrawal request of accrued benefits?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_114" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can change the payment method by submitting a written instruction or making a verbal instruction via the HSBC MPF Member Hotline on +<a href="tel:+852-3128-0128" class="no-link" role="presentation">852 3128 0128</a> with the relevant supporting document (if applicable). If you choose to direct deposit the payment into your bank account, please provide supporting document which shows bank account number and name of account holder, such as copy of bank statement, copy of bank ATM card or copy of bank reference letter, etc. for verification purpose.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_11">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_12" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_13">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="payment-of-benefits"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Payment of Benefits
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_115" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I withdraw my accrued benefits derived from mandatory contributions?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_116" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">According to MPF legislation, you can only withdraw your accrued benefits derived from mandatory contributions when any one of the following circumstances occurs:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>the Members 65th birthday;</li> 
 <li>the Members death (in which case the accrued benefits are paid to the Members legal personal representatives);</li> 
 <li>the total incapacity of the Member;</li> 
 <li>the terminal illness of the Member;</li> 
 <li>the early retirement of the Member on or after reaching age 60;</li> 
 <li>the Members permanent departure from Hong Kong; or</li> 
 <li>the Members claim on small balance under section 162 (1)(c) of the General Regulation.<br> </li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">From 1 February 2016, you can withdraw your accrued benefits in instalments on the grounds of retirement at age 65 or early retirement at age 60.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_117" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I am now 65 years old and have ceased employment, what should I do with my MPF accrued benefits?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_118" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can choose to withdraw your MPF accrued benefits in a lump sum when you attain the retirement age of 65 or retain them in the existing scheme until you wish to withdraw them. From 1 February 2016, you can choose to withdraw your MPF accrued benefits in instalments on the grounds of retirement at age 65. You may specify the withdrawal amount you wish to withdraw by submitting to us a valid 'Claim Form for Payment of Accrued Benefits on Ground of Attaining the Retirement Age of 65 or Early Retirement' (<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inpr.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INPR</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INPR  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) together with the necessary supporting document(s).<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_119" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I am above 65 years of age and still employed, what should I do with my MPF accrued benefits?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_120" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can choose to withdraw your MPF accrued benefits in a lump sum when you attain the retirement age of 65 or retain them in the existing scheme until you wish to withdraw them. From 1 February 2016, you can choose to withdraw your MPF accrued benefits in instalments on the grounds of retirement at age 65. You may specify the withdrawal amount you wish to withdraw by submitting to us a valid 'Claim Form for Payment of Accrued Benefits on Ground of Attaining the Retirement Age of 65 or Early Retirement' <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inpr.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">(INPR)</span><span class="visuallyhidden">(INPR)  This link will open in a new window</span></a> together with the necessary supporting document(s). However, any voluntary contributions made under a contractual arrangement with your current employer can only be withdrawn with your employer's consent as you are still under employment (Please fill in the<u> <a rel="noopener" target="_blank" href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inat.pdf"><span aria-hidden="true">INAT form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INAT form  This link will open in a new window</span></a></u>).</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_121" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I claim my MPF mandatory benefits?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_122" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/mpf/products/employees/managing/#making-a-claim" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Making a Claim</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Making a Claim  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_123" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I am going to depart from Hong Kong permanently and reside in another country/region, what should I do with my MPF accrued benefits?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_124" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You may choose to withdraw your MPF accrued benefits if you are departing from Hong Kong permanently and do not intend to return to Hong Kong. You may withdraw your accrued benefits by submitting us the following documents:<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL" style="margin-left: 40px;">(i)  a completed Claim Form for Payment of MPF Accrued Benefits on Ground of Permanent Departure from Hong Kong/Total Incapacity/Terminal Illness/Small Balance/Death (INPO)</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL" style="margin-left: 40px;">(ii) the Statutory Declaration for Claims for Payment of MPF Accrued Benefits (Benefits) on Grounds of Permanent Departure from Hong Kong (MPF(S)  W(SD2))</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL" style="margin-left: 40px;">(iii) the Statutory Declaration made by The Committee of the Estate of a Scheme Member for Claims for Payment of MPF Accrued Benefits (MPF(S)  W(SD4)* (if applicable)</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL" style="margin-left: 40px;">(iv) a copy of your HKID card</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL" style="margin-left: 40px;">(v)  a copy of the documents/evidence that you are permitted to reside in a place other than Hong Kong that is., e.g. immigration visa/foreign passport</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL" style="margin-left: 40px;">(vi) a copy of the Letter of Release issued by the Inland Revenue Department (if applicable)</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In addition, if you/the claimant wish(es) to claim the benefits from the scheme members MPF contribution account, a written notification of the scheme members cessation of employment issued by the employer to the trustee is required. If the employer fails to do so, the processing of such claim with respect to the relevant MPF account(s) stated in the claim form may be delayed until the trustee of the HSBC MPF scheme<strong><em> </em></strong>receives the above written notification from the employer.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL"><sup>*</sup>Supporting documentation for claiming accrued benefits by committee of estate on behalf of a mentally incapacitated scheme member.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_125" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I claim my accrued benefits if the date of departure cannot be confirmed at this moment?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_126" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you cannot. When you make a statutory declaration under the Statutory Declaration for Claims for Payment of MPF Accrued Benefits (Benefits) on Grounds of Permanent Departure from Hong Kong (MPF(S)  W(SD2)), you are required to specify in the declaration the date on which you will depart from Hong Kong permanently.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_127" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I have ceased employment with my employer. If I want to claim the accrued benefits from my MPF contribution account, besides the other supporting documents mentioned in the claim form, what other documents may be required?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_128" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have ceased employment and wish to claim the accrued benefit from the MPF contribution account in respect of that employment (except for the claim on the ground of normal retirement), your former employer is required to provide written notification of your cessation of employment to the trustee. If the employer fails to do so, the claim processing may possibly be delayed. We will process the claim upon receipt of the termination notification and the required documents/information.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Regarding the claim on the grounds of normal retirement, if your account has voluntary contribution (ie not include MPF non-preserved transfers), your former employer is still required to provide the written notification of your cessation of employment to the trustee. If the employer fails to do so, only the mandatory contribution and the MPF non-preserved transfers (if any) would be released to you and the claim processing of remaining balance may possibly be delayed. We will process the claim of remaining balance upon receipt of the termination notification and/or the required documents/information.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_129" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Under what circumstances, member can choose to withdraw the accrued benefits in instalments? What should be noted?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_130" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">From 1 February 2016, members who reach the retirement age of 65 or early retirement at age 60 can withdraw their accrued benefits in instalments.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For withdrawal by instalment, please take note of the following:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>If you choose to withdraw the accrued benefits in instalments, the benefits retain in your accounts will continue to be invested in your chosen Constituent Fund(s). The values of these assets may change due to market fluctuations and investment risks. Your account will be subject to management fees and other charges based on its total asset value, as usual.<br> </li> 
 <li>If you have invested in a Guaranteed Fund, please refer to the 'Guarantee features' under 'Guaranteed Fund' in the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/mpf_scheme_brochure.pdf">MPF Scheme Brochure</a> for details of the guarantee features (including in the context of payment of accrued benefits in instalments) and the Guarantee Conditions.<br> </li> 
 <li>For the purpose of preventing inattentive small account balance of accrued benefits remained in your MPF account after the withdrawal by instalment, if your account balance is less than or equal to 105% of your requested withdrawal amount, your entire account balance will be withdrawn as a lump sum. However, if you would not like to have this 105% arrangement applied but prefer to be paid the exact amount per your request even if small account balance of accrued benefits may be remained in your MPF account after the withdrawal, you could specify your request in Item (3) under Section II of the CLAIM FORM FOR PAYMENT OF MPF ACCRUED BENEFITS (BENEFITS) ON GROUNDS OF ATTAINING THE RETIREMENT AGE OF 65 OR EARLY RETIREMENT (INPR form).<br> </li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_131" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Where can I make a statutory declaration?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_132" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In Hong Kong, the statutory declaration must be made before and signed by a Commissioner for Oath at either the Public Enquiry Service Centre of the Home Affairs Department, a Notary Public or a Justice of the Peace. A statutory declaration made in a place other than Hong Kong is also acceptable provided that it is made before and signed by a Notary Public or a person authorised under the law of that place to administer an oath or take a statutory declaration.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_133" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If a member passes away, to whom will his/her accrued benefits be paid? Can a member designate a beneficiary during enrolment?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_134" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">By law, the accrued benefits of a deceased member will be payable to his/her personal representative as indicated in a Letter of Probate or Letter of Administration granted by the Probate Registry. Members do not need to designate any beneficiary during enrolment.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_135" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If a member passes away, how should his/her personal representative claim the accrued benefits?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_136" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The personal representative should complete a 'Claim Form for Payment of Accrued Benefits on Ground of Permanent Departure from Hong Kong/Total Incapacity/Terminal Illness/Small Balance/Death [Form MPF(S) - W(O)]' (INPO) and submit it with the following documents to us:</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
<li>A copy of the claimant's HKID card for verification of the name and identity card number of the claimant if the claimant does not wish to present the card in person for verification</li>
<li>A copy of the Letter of Probate or Letters of Administration granted by the Probate Registry / a letter requesting withdrawal of the accrued benefits issued by the Official Administrator if the claim is made by the Official Administrator</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/inpo.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Download INPO form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Download INPO form  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_137" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How to obtain a Letter of Probate or Letter of Administration? </strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_138" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can apply to the Probate Registry for the desired form. For details of the application procedures, you may visit the <a href="https://www.judiciary.hk/en/home/index.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Judiciary website</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Judiciary website  This link will open in a new window</span></a> for information about Guide to Court Services (Probate).<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_139" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How the contribution(s) paid to my contribution account in respect of the former employment will be handled if that amount(s) is/are received after account termination with accrued benefits transferred or paid out from the contribution account already? </strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_140" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Under normal circumstances, the contribution(s) will be handled in the below manner:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>for the case where the accrued benefits under the contribution account have already been transferred to an MPF account of another scheme ("New Scheme") , the contribution(s) will be transferred to the MPF account of the New Scheme;<br> </li> 
 <li>for the case where the accrued benefits under the contribution account have been transferred to another MPF account ("New Account") within the same HSBC MPF scheme, the contribution(s) will be invested in accordance with the latest investment mandate of the New Account;<br> </li> 
 <li>for the case where the accrued benefits have already been claimed from the contribution account, the contribution(s) will be paid to the same claimant.<br> </li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_14">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="personal-account-opening-and-consolidation"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Personal Account Opening and Consolidation<u></u>
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_141" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I open and consolidate MPF personal account(s) on the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You may open and consolidate MPF personal account(s) on the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app if you are an existing HSBC customer without an HSBC MPF personal account.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note that you are required to logon and confirm your submission with Mobile Security Key (either use Mobile Security Key password or Biometric authentication) or physical Security Device.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can access this function by following the below steps:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Scroll down in the 'Home' screen and choose your MPF account</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Select Open a personal account for MPF personal accounts consolidation'</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Take photos of your HKID card and yourself for identification and verification purposes</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Enter the required basic information, tax residency information and investment options for account setup</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Enter the personal account information for the accounts that will be consolidated with the MPF personal account</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Verify the information has been inputted</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Accept 'Declaration & Authorisation' and submit</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please save or download the PDF forms and the confirmation page image to your device for record.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Alternatively, you can complete a Personal Account Holder Application Form (IN81 form) and Scheme Member's Request for Account Consolidation Form (MPF(S)-P(C) form) and return it to us by mail or designated HSBC branch drop-in box. You can download the <u><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in81.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">IN81 form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">IN81 form  This link will open in a new window</span></a></u> and <u><a href="https://www.mpfa.org.hk/en/home/useful-tools/forms/mpf-schemes/consolidation-of-personal-accounts" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">MPF(S)-P(C) form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">MPF(S)-P(C) form  This link will open in a new window</span></a></u> (Download from MPFA's website) here.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Who is eligible for MPF personal account opening and consolidation using the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You may open and consolidate MPF personal account(s) on the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app if you are an existing HSBC customer without an HSBC MPF personal account.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note that you are required to logon and confirm your submission with Mobile Security Key (either use Mobile Security Key password or Biometric authentication) or physical Security Device.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What documents do I need to open and consolidate MPF personal accounts via the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Before MPF personal account opening and consolidation, please ensure you have the name(s) of trustee(s), the scheme member account number(s) of the account(s) to be transferred/consolidated into HSBC MPF, as well as your HKID card (as your HKID card copy may be provided to your original trustee(s) for the purpose of processing the account transfer).</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Your scheme member account number can be found in your notice of participation or, as the case may be, membership certificate, notice of acceptance, or annual benefit statement, or you can contact the relevant trustee(s) for assistance.  For the relevant trustee(s) contact information, please visit the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority (MPFA) webpage.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens next after I have submitted the MPF personal account opening and consolidation request via the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">After submitting the MPF personal account opening and consolidation request, you'll receive an acknowledgement message in the HSBC HK Mobile Banking App within the next 24 hours. Please check for the message on the mobile app.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The new MPF personal account will generally be set up in five working days.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">After your new MPF personal account is set up, your consolidation requests will be sent to the original trustee(s) for processing within the next five working days.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">It will take around four to six weeks for the entire MPF personal account consolidation process and we will issue a statement to you when it's complete.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">After we receive the MPF benefits from your original trustee(s), we will settle the transfer-in within three working days.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In the future if you want to submit instruction(s) outside online platforms, please visit any designated HSBC branch and provide your signature specimen by submitting the Change of Member Signature Specimen form (IN92). Otherwise, instructions submitted in the future outside online platforms cant be processed.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note that we accept straight-through submissions for MPF personal account opening and consolidation requests within HSBC MPF trusteeship through our mobile app. However, our servicing staff may reach out to you to collect additional information, such as your wet signature, as this information may be required by other original trustee(s).</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I know if my MPF personal account has been successfully opened?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your MPF personal account has been successfully opened, youll receive an enrolment confirmation letter in paper form. Youll also see that the new account under MPF account summary page after you login to the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app or HSBC Online Banking.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_15">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="personal-Internet-banking"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Personal Internet Banking (MPF Service)*
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_142" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">* The below information provided is for Personal Internet Banking (MPF service) reference only. For Personal Internet Banking (banking service), please refer to "Banking" on this website for details.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What if I forget my Personal Internet Banking (MPF service) username?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you forget your HSBC Personal Internet Banking (MPF service) username, please contact our HSBC MPF Member Hotline on +852 3128 0128.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If my physical Security Device is out of battery, what can I do?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your physical Security Device is out of battery, please contact our HSBC MPF Member Hotline at +852 3128 0128.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Or</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can log on HSBC Online Banking with your username and security code generated from Mobile Security Key. Or you may also log on with your username and Personal Internet Banking password. You'll need to generate a security code from your Mobile Security Key, or complete SMS verification the first time you log on to HSBC Online Banking.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What information do I need to register for HSBC Personal Internet Banking to manage my MPF account(s)?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><br> To register for HSBC Personal Internet Banking with your MPF account(s), please ensure that your MPF account record with us contains the following personal information:</p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li><span style="background-color: transparent;">An email address</span></li> 
 <li>A mobile phone number</li> 
 <li>A residential address in English</li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If any of the above information is missing or outdated in your MPF account record, please update your record by completing the Personal Details Change Form (Download <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in91.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">IN91 form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">IN91 form  This link will open in a new window</span></a>) and return to us before proceeding with registration.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_12">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_13" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_16">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="transfer-benefits"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Transfer MPF Benefits to HSBC
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            





        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_143" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I transfer my MPF accrued benefits from other MPF service providers to HSBC MPF?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_144" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are using the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app, and you are our existing MPF customer with a HSBC bank account, you can transfer the accrued benefits from other MPF service providers and consolidate your personal account(s) into HSBC MPF via mobile. You can access to this function by entering into your MPF account(s) from the Mobile apps Home Page*.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">* Please note that you are required to logon and confirm your submission with Mobile Security Key (either use Mobile Security Key password or Biometric authentication) or physical Security Device.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Alternatively, you can complete a Scheme Member's Request for Fund Transfer Form (INPM form) and return it to us. You can download the <u><a href="/mpf/regulatory-require/inpm/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INPM form here</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INPM form here  This link will open in a new window</span></a></u>. If you would also like to apply for a HSBC MPF personal account, you should complete a Personal Account Holder Application Form (<u><a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in81.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">IN81</span><span class="visuallyhidden">IN81  This link will open in a new window</span></a></u>) and return it along with your INPM form.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Who is eligible for Personal Account consolidation using the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You need to be our existing MPF customer, with a MPF Personal Account or Contribution Account, and also an HSBC bank account with us.  Please note that you are required to logon and confirm your submission with Mobile Security Key (either use Mobile Security Key password or Biometric authentication) or physical Security Device.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What documents do I need to consolidate personal accounts via the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Before consolidation, please ensure you have the name(s) of trustee(s), the scheme member account number(s) of the account(s) to be transferred/consolidated into HSBC MPF, as well as your HKID card as your HKID copy will be submitted to your original trustee(s).</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can find the relevant information in your latest MPF benefit statement, or contact the relevant trustee(s) for assistance. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens after I submit a consolidation request via the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">After submitting the consolidation request, you'll receive an acknowledgement message in the HSBC HK App (Supports > Messages) within 24 hours. Please check the message on the mobile app.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note that requests submitted to us at or before 12 noon on working days will be sent to the original trustee on the next working day.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Requests submitted to us on non-working days, or after 12 noon on working days, will be processed on the next working day and sent to the original trustee the day after.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Usually the original trustee(s) will complete the accrued benefit transfer within 30 days.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">After we received the MPF accrued benefits from the original trustee, we will process the transfer-in within 3 working days and issue a statement to your MPF registered address upon completion.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can check the completion record in Contribution & transaction history under your MPF account upon consolidation completion via mobile app.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note that we accept straight-through submissions for consolidation requests within HSBC MPF trusteeship through our mobile app. However, our servicing staff may reach out to you to collect additional information, such as your wet signature, as this information may be required by other original trustee(s).</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_145" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I check my existing MPF account information in order for HSBC to process the transfer?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_146" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can review the latest statement from your existing MPF service provider or contact your existing trustee.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_147" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I speed up the transfer process?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_148" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can attach copies of the latest member benefit statement issued by your existing MPF service provider(s) and your identification document when submitting your transfer request to us, which may facilitate the verification process to be done by the transferor trustee. Please be reminded to tick the box under the Section 'Authorisation and Declaration' of <a href="/mpf/regulatory-require/inpm/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">INPM form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">INPM form  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_13">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_14" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_17">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="voluntary-contributions"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Voluntary Contributions
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            





        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_149" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I withdraw my voluntary contributions?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_150" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Complete a Partial Withdrawal Request Form. Please note the instructions and requirements stated on the form. <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/mpf/in54.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Download IN54 form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Download IN54 form  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_151" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are there any restrictions in withdrawing my voluntary contributions?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_152" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You may request to withdraw your voluntary contributions up to 12 times in a financial year (from 1 July to 30 June each year), subject to a minimum of HKD5,000 per withdrawal. Where applicable you may need to obtain your employer's approval.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_153" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I retain my voluntary contributions in the MPF scheme after cessation of employment?</strong><br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_154" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. You can retain your voluntary contributions in a personal account of an MPF scheme. When you complete a Scheme Member's Request for Fund Transfer Form (INPM form) to inform us of your choice of treatment for your accrued benefits, you can notify us to handle your voluntary contributions in the same way as the mandatory contributions. If you have not submitted a Scheme Member's Request for Fund Transfer Form (INPM form) to us, you can download the <a href="/mpf/regulatory-require/inpm/" target="_self">INPM form</a> here.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    <div class="anchor" id="cautions"></div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_14">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_15" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_155" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>CAUTIONS</strong><br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please be aware that you <strong>should NOT</strong> hand in any MPF documents (in particular for those paper remittance statement and cheque payment (if any) which must be submitted on time according to the MPF legislation) to unauthorised channels. Unauthorised channels include but not limited to:</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(1) the staff at service counters at the branches,<br>
(2) the branches without 'HSBC MPF Drop-In Box', or<br>
(3) other collection boxes in the branches (for examples, the collection boxes for cheque payment).</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Any submission of the MPF documents to unauthorised channels will not be forwarded to the MPF department for processing directly and it may take a longer time for the documents to be transferred to the MPF department. While the receipt date by the MPF department will be stamped only when the documents reach the MPF department, you please be cautious that this will result in delay in receiving and processing the paper remittance statement or other instructions by the MPF department. Any failure to pay mandatory contributions in full and on time to a trustee incurs a 5% surcharge on the outstanding mandatory contributions, along with the possibility of a financial penalty and even imprisonment by the MPFA. You may refer to the MPFA's website <a title="This link exits HSBC's website. HSBC assumes no liability or control for your use of this link. Please refer to our Hyperlink Policy."></a><a target="_blank" href="http://www.mpfa.org.hk/eng/main/index.jsp" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">www.mpfa.org.hk</span><span class="visuallyhidden">www.mpfa.org.hk  This link will open in a new window</span></a> for further details of offences and penalties.</p>

</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </div>
